I join one of these communities and a couple months later they botched a prize pool, so they ended that community and made a new one... my friend was on the receiving end of this botched prize pool and still has not gotten his full reward. I also have proof of harassment to some of the people in the community and I think the way they handled things were very strange and yet somehow they were able to hand out prizes all the time and have regular tournaments.

If you are just going to give this power of running a community to some random people to manage money and to hand out prizes, maybe checking up on them should be another priority.

Riot would rather sit back and do nothing while taking no responsibility for the tournament holder just typing in the codes as soon as they mail them to him. That being said, its really the only way they can keep the tournaments going, as soon as there becomes too much regulation, no one will want to go through the trouble to host or play in one unless its a riot sanctioned event, they can't monitor EVERY small 5v5 match that gets acknowledged as a tournament, itd be foolish to even try. you should be glad they're this free with just trusting randoms and handing out actual prizes without even knowing whether or not the tournament will take place.

If this is not accurate, what do you know about this said community that I have not named that you know? To say that I am in fact that I am being bias toward Riot, what makes you assume I have this said bias. I am just telling Riot what one of their communities has done and am informing them that stuff goes down that they don't know about that they sponsor. 

If you sponsor someone, you have to make sure that they treat your brand and represent your name. This unnamed community has not been representing Riot very well. What is biased about that?

I am posting something that has happened. I absolutely love Riot, I posted this so that the community can see what has happened when you give random people power and money to hand out to random people.

There are good communities out there, since then I have joined another one that is so much better. But a community that botched up so bad they deleted a TS server and made a whole new server and re-branded, this is the facts I am giving. I am leaving my bias out because I hate bias.

As a community leader you should be careful what you say and do because everyone depends to keep that community afloat and be accountable and fair. Just being rude and getting "butt hurt" over what someone posted about another community is not targeting your community. No names of any community but Riot has been mentioned and your comment was blind aimed and unnecessary. If I ever found out what community you ran, I would steer clear from it.
I approve this message.

I'm not posting this for likes so I can be proud that I am popular, I posted this because this has happened to a community that was part of and supposedly sponsored by Riot. Me and my friends join this community, participated and had fun. BUT that does not excuse some of the activity that was allowed and the power given to some of the admins. There was an admin who was harassing one of my friends and I have the conversation saved. And I have my other suspicions about the community but I have no proof so I have left those parts out.

All I want is Riot to get better and in order to get better, you have to acknowledge that something is wrong and then find a solution.
